description: Legendary comic Carlin comes back to the Beacon theater to angrily rant about airport security, germs, cigars, angels, children and parents, men, names, religion, god, advertising, Bill Jeff and minorities.
keywords: stand up,stand up comedian,gallows humor,crude humor,shock humor
name: George Carlin: You Are All Diseased

original_info.id: George Carlin: You are All Diseased_1999
original_info.name: George Carlin: You are All Diseased

review.name: George- Your best yet
review.reviewBody: George Carlin shows his comedy has changed in the years since he started 43 years ago with this special. Here, anger fuels his comedy more than ever before, and it helps alot. Here, he attacks Children and parents, cigars, angels, theme restaurants, advertising (ironically), religion, god, airport security and germs. With this, he brings a whole new type of stylish comedy that makes Richard Pryor look like Carrot Top. At 61, George comes back with his best, and wins. Best comedy special of the year. A++
